data.title: PhysicsBody setDynamic
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.10
- devices test on: Windows
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version: 2017
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a PhysicsBody to a Node
2. Set the PhysicsBody as Dynamic
3. After a while set the PhysicsBody as Static
4. Set it again as Dynamic
5. The PhysicsBody remains static

data.title: XXTea bindings in lua
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15

Does xxtea aviable in lua for now? If not, we really need bindings for it in lua (and js probably?).

data.title: why RuntimeEngine is no longer supported in 3.15?
data.body: I upgraded the engine from 3.7 to 3.15, found that RuntimeEngine is no longer supported by default? I used to collect log from console window and interact with engine via CCConsole tool, why these tools are removed and how I can get them work again? Or is there some other more convenient debug tool?

data.title: Get data from zip in lua
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15

I want to get resource file from zip, but it looks like it is impossible in lua or js. I think that we really need port of `getFileDataFromZip` in those languages.

Or did I understood purpose of this function wrong?

data.title: Allow extensions to work out of the box by default on Win32 C++ projects
data.body:
Adding `#include "cocos-ext.h"` in the `HelloWorldScene.cpp` of a new C++ project and compiling the Win32 project will yield: 

````
Cannot open include file: 'extensions/ExtensionExport.h': No such file or directory
````

This patch fixes that.

data.title: Fix issue #15926
Fix iskindof
data.body:
**For Cocos2dx-lua**
Test code -
```
local NodeOne = class("NodeOne", cc.Node)
local NodeTwo = class("NodeTwo", NodeOne)

local PureTbOne = class("PureTbOne")
local PureTbTwo = class("PureTbTwo")
local PureTbThree = class("PureTbThree", PureTbTwo)
local MixPureTbs = class("MixPureTbs", PureTbOne, PureTbTwo)

local MixNodeAndPureTb = class("MixNodeAndPureTb", MixPureTbs, NodeTwo)

local node = NodeTwo:create()
print(iskindof(node, "NodeOne"))
print(iskindof(node, "NodeTwo"))
print(iskindof(node, "cc.Node"))

local pure = PureTbThree:create()
print(iskindof(pure, "PureTbTwo"))
print(iskindof(pure, "PureTbThree"))

local mixTbs = MixPureTbs:create()
print(iskindof(mixTbs, "PureTbOne"))
print(iskindof(mixTbs, "PureTbTwo"))
print(iskindof(mixTbs, "MixPureTbs"))

local mixNodePure = MixNodeAndPureTb:create()
print(iskindof(mixNodePure, "NodeTwo"))
print(iskindof(mixNodePure, "NodeOne"))
print(iskindof(mixNodePure, "PureTbOne"))
print(iskindof(mixNodePure, "PureTbTwo"))
print(iskindof(mixNodePure, "MixPureTbs"))
print(iskindof(mixNodePure, "MixNodeAndPureTb"))
print(iskindof(mixNodePure, "cc.Node"))
```
**Will get error with above code !**

**After This Pull request, the output will all be true, I have tested !**

data.title: [Feature request] Haptic Feedback
data.body:
In Cocos2d-x we have `Device::vibrate(float duration)` to trigger device vibration. üôÇ
Similarly it could be very useful to have multi platform haptic feedbacks.
On iOS it is very straightforward to implement, I don't know nothing about Android.
Referer the iOS documentation [here](https://developer.apple.com/reference/uikit/uifeedbackgenerator).

The ideal could be something like that:

```
Device::impactOccurred( impactIntensity )
Device::notificationOccurred( notificationType )
Device::selectionOccurred( )
```

data.title: update 3rd party version to update luajit
Crash when AudioEngine::end() is called from AppDelegate.cpp
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: v3.15
- devices test on: Windows win32
- developing environments
   - NDK version: -
   - Xcode version: -
   - VS version: VS2017
   - browser type and version: -

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use the experimental audio engine (enable the USE_AUDIO_ENGINE define in AppDelegate.cpp).
2. Close the game window manually (like clicking the X icon on the window).

When AudioEngine::end() deletes the audio engine implementation instance via "delete _audioEngineImpl;", that calls the destructor "AudioEngineImpl::~AudioEngineImpl".  In that destructor it tries to do the following:

if (_scheduler != nullptr)
{
    _scheduler->unschedule(CC_SCHEDULE_SELECTOR(AudioEngineImpl::update), this);
}

The issue is that the _scheduler points to an instance that was freed when Director was freed, which happens before the AudioEngineImpl destructor is called.  Since AudioEngineImpl _scheduler is still pointing to a memory location that is no longer valid, it causes a crash in Scheduler::unschedule, since it tries to access freed memory.

The reason this happens is because Director::end() is called to do a cleanup from Application::run(), and it cleans up all memory associated with the Director instance before the AudioEngineImpl destructor is called.  

The destructor AppDelegate::~AppDelegate() is perhaps not the best place to call experimental::AudioEngine::end().  This exists in the C++ code template that is generated.  Where is the best place to put the experimental::AudioEngine::end() call?

data.title: setContentSize and setScale give poor graphic quality
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on: iPhone

I want to create sprite with size is relative to the screen size. I.e: Sprite size is equal to screen width * 0.2.

I use `setContentSize` but it gives ugly and poor graphic quality. I've read about multiple resolution supports, but it doesn't work on this case because i need sprite size adapt to the any screen size.

This is an error of cocos2d-x or anyway to archive it?

data.title: websockets can't connect to localhost ws server , can't initiate connection
csb bug in cocos2d-x 3.15
data.body:
I upgraded my game from version 3.141 to version 3.15 and found some bugs.

1) In previous versions, applying opacity or fade-action to a node created with Cocostudio in code has been applied to all children. However, in 3.15, it seems that Opacity or Fade may not apply to Children.
2) Alignment of Text created in Cocostudio is not applied. Also, custom-size does not apply. In my game, the text alignment setting is to the left, but it is centered (the alignment value is displayed correctly in the debugger).
3) Animation may stop without reason. So EndCallback does not run and stops.

As a result, Cocostudio Runtime seems to have problems in 3.15.
I want to be fix as soon as possible.

data.title: Fix space wrapping in CCLabelTextFormatter
data.body: Previously, if you insert spaces at the end of a long string, the line would not wrap. The fix introduces correct wrapping for spaces.

data.title: Commit #b017934 for OpenGLES3 breaks multisampling on iOS
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: iPhone 7 plus

Steps to Reproduce:
Commit #b017934 made changes to cocos/platform/ios/CCES2Renderer-ios.m.
Now running this following code creates a black screen with swap buffer errors.
```
CCEAGLView *eaglView = [CCEAGLView viewWithFrame: [self.window bounds]
                                     pixelFormat: (__bridge NSString *)cocos2d::GLViewImpl::_pixelFormat
                                     depthFormat: cocos2d::GLViewImpl::_depthFormat
                              preserveBackbuffer: NO
                                      sharegroup: nil
                                   multiSampling: YES // Setting multisampling to YES
                                 numberOfSamples: 4]; // Setting numberOfSamples to 4
```
More info here:
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/b0179340be4a2dc956c8ada5c1d0ee9ec34a2d0e

data.title: What could be the max value of MAX_AUDIOINSTANCES, default is 24.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15

The sounds just stops when loads of files are played simultaneously. By setting  MAX_AUDIOINSTANCES to 64 solve the issue temporarily. What could be the safest max value of  MAX_AUDIOINSTANCES?

Thanks

data.title: Moved CC_SYNTHESIZE and CC_PROPERTY macros onto a single line
data.body:
This permits comments to be visible in tooltips for the variable and it's associated accessor functions

e.g.
```
//The health of the entity, when this reaches zero the entity is dead
CC_SYNTHESIZE(float, m_health, Health)
```

Previously the above comment would only be displayed in the tooltip for the member variable

data.title: Added function for calculating md5 hash from Data.
data.body:
getFileMD5Hash now use getDataMD5Hash.

For example, AssetsManagerEx VerifyCallback.
Get Data from file, check equal size, if equal to get md5 hash.
